Detailed Description

Produces Jacobian and forward kinematics expressions.

takes a smart pointer to a serial manipulator containing Denavit-Hartenberg (D-H) parameters.

ExpressionMatrix JFKengine::getForwardKinematics (  const robot::KinematicChain &    chain ) 
 

forms forward kinematics expression matrices A and T, using D-H parameters of first n joints of manipulator.

Parameters:
chain  a description of a chain of joints each specificed via D-H parameters from which expression matrices are to be formed.
Returns:
A 4 x 4 ExpressionMatrix containing transformation matrix T for the given SerialManipulator; + T represents the position and orientation of the nth link with reference to the base coordinate frame of the manipulator.
Exceptions:
std::out_of_range  exception, if no joints are specified or n is greater than the number of joints in manipulator

Definition at line 37 of file JFKengine.cpp.

References A, d, Debugc, Debugcln, Debugln, DH_AT, base::ExpressionMatrix, forwardKinematicsCached, base::Int, base::Real, robot::KinematicChain::resize, base::array< ExpressionMatrix >::resize, base::array< ExpressionMatrix >::size, robot::KinematicChain::size, and T.

Referenced by getJacobian, and getJointLocations.

ExpressionMatrix JFKengine::getJacobian (  const robot::KinematicChain &    chain,
bool    includeOrientation = true
) 
 

forms Jacobian expression, using D-H parameters of first n joints of manipulator.

If forward kinematics have not already been calculated for this manipulator, then getForwardKinematics is called.

Parameters:
chain  a description of a chain of joints each specified via D-H parameters for which the Jacobian is to be formed.
includeOrientation  if true, J will be a 6 x n ExpressionMatrix with orientation components otherwise it will be a 3 x n ExpressionMatrix including only position components
Returns:
A [6|3] x n ExpressionMatrix containing the Jacobian for the given SerialManipulator. n is the number of joints in the given chain.
Exceptions:
std::out_of_range  exception, if no joints are specified
Todo:
check & document if this is the Geometric Jacobian or Analytical Jacobian (in Jg the orientation components represent ang. vel (omega), in Ja the orientation components represent the time derivative of Euler angles - theta_dot) - I think this implementation is Jg. (omega is better for representing ang. velocity than theta_dot. On the other hand, the intergral of theta_dot, Euler angles themselves (theta) can easily represent orientation, but the intergral of omega has no physical meaning (called quasi-coordinates))

Definition at line 135 of file JFKengine.cpp.

References Debugcln, Debugln, DH_J, base::ExpressionMatrix, getForwardKinematics, base::Int, J, JCached, robot::KinematicChain::resize, robot::KinematicChain::size, and T.

array< Vector > JFKengine::getJointLocations (  const robot::KinematicChain &    chain,
const Vector &    jointValues
) 
 

evaluates the forward kinematics expressions to return the joint locations.

If forward kinematics have not already been calculated for this chain, then getForwardKinematics is called.

Parameters:
chain  a description of a chain of joints specified via D-H parameters
jointValues  array of Reals; jointValues[0] is the value of the variable for the first joint
Returns:
loc array of [x,y,z] Vector3s that give the location of each joint
Todo:
is it faster to call forwardKinematics() and then loop through evaluating the symbolic T[i]'s or perhaps faster to do everything numerically - calc numerical A[i]'s and loop through multiplying them. In particular isn't it cheaper to compute: (A0*...(An-2*(An-1*(An*0)))...) rather than A0*A1*...An*0?? (as the former involves only matrix*vector ops, whereas the later involves matrix products (correct? - they are equivelent, aren't they?) )

virtual void base::Referenced::onUnreference (    )  const [inline, virtual, inherited]

bool base::Referenced::unreference (    )  const [inline, inherited]
 

Decrement the reference count by one, indicating that a pointer to this object is referencing it. If the refence count goes to zero, it is assumed that this object is nolonger referenced and is automatically deleted.
